intro: Hieracium comanticeps, commonly known as the Cretan hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a cluster, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium comanticeps is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands.
